definition: stable prices/commodity prices fixed by government (in a command economy)/to valorize (a commodity)

sentences.english: Li Chunlin was removed from the post of Director-General of the Price Control Administration of Jiangsu Province.
sentences.chinese: 免去李春林同志的江苏省物价局副局长职务。

sentences.english: Farmers, encouraged by high prices, have been planting more grain.
sentences.chinese: 农民受高物价鼓励，已经种植了更多的作物。

sentences.english: A rise in prices nullifies a rise in wages.
sentences.chinese: 物价上涨抵销了工资的增加。

sentences.english: Price is soaring. If it goes on like this, we shall not be able to keep the pot boiling.
sentences.chinese: 物价直线上升，这样子下去，我们都快要揭不开锅了。

sentences.english: In some countries, prices are exorbitantly high which are ten as much as that in China.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家的物价水平高，大概是中国国内的十倍。

sentences.english: Maintaining price stability is also a central concern of policy.
sentences.chinese: 维持物价平稳也是政策关注的中心。

sentences.english: The tempos of income refer to real tempo, The price factor is taken out.
sentences.chinese: 收入发展速度为扣除物价因素后的实际发展速度。

sentences.english: Prices and wages were badly out of line.
sentences.chinese: 物价与工作非常不协调。

sentences.english: Following the closure of the checkpoint, prices of commodities especially those from Thailand have increased.
sentences.chinese: 大平检查站关闭后，物价尤其是来自泰国的商品高涨。

sentences.english: If the prices continue to go up, people will begin to kick.
sentences.chinese: 如果物价继续上涨，人们就会开始抱怨了。

sentences.english: With prices rising, many young couples are unable to make ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 由于物价的上涨，很多年轻夫妻是入不敷出。

sentences.english: We must not take this issue lightly.
sentences.chinese: 对于物价，我们不敢掉以轻心。
通货膨胀使物价节节上涨。

sentences.english: Low prices crimped domestic output and foreign imports.
sentences.chinese: 低物价阻碍了国内出口和国外进口。

sentences.english: The store owner always jacks up his prices before Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 这家店老板总在耶诞节前哄抬物价。

definition: measures of national income and output

pinyin: e4 xing4 tong1 huo4 peng2 zhang4

definition: stable prices/commodity prices fixed by government (in a command economy)/to valorize (a commodity)
